articles.content: The sizes and shapes of sharks vary considerably. According to the Smithsonian, the smallest shark alive is the lantern shark, which is smaller than the human hand. Oceana says the mouth of sharks na… [+1436 chars]

articles.title: Ep. 263: A Delicate Balance - NASA
articles.description: The human body can adapt to function in reduced levels of gravity, but not without some help. Learn how NASA's Neuroscience Lab is finding ways to help future astronauts be safe and productive on exploration missions to the Moon and Mars. HWHAP Episode 263.

articles.author: Giulia Carbonaro
articles.title: Life on Mars? Research finds 280 million-year-old bacteria could be buried below planet's surface - Euronews
articles.description: A new study has found that there’s a good chance we'll find life on Mars buried under the planet’s surface hundreds of millions of years ago.
articles.content:
Is there life on Mars? Until now, this question, which has endlessly fascinated us all on Earth, had a definitive answer: not that we know of.
The surface of the Red Planet is dry and immensely cold… [+2478 chars]

articles.title: Haunting new Hubble galaxy cluster image puts dark matter front and center - Inverse
